name: skittishly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of people and animals) in a way that is nervous or easily frightened: He glanced skittishly up and down the corridor. His horse cantered skittishly, startled by the sudden movement.
(of a person's beliefs or opinions) in a way that is not serious and that is likely to change often: He skittishly avoided dwelling too deeply on the experience. This book moves skittishly from topic to topic. See
skittish
More examplesFewer examplesThe birds skittishly jumped from branch to branch.The horse moved skittishly but he steadied her, using his feet. She skittishly refused to be introduced to the director and cast.
